intro: Tragia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual shrub with hairy stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Tragia parvifolia is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
